question: 絶える
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>die out</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to die out</vocabulary>. You know that this one is "to die out" because you're up in the <reading>air</reading> (<ja>える</ja>), looking down at the dinosaurs, who are all dying out. Thank goodness you're up in the air, because the ground is all on fire.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading can come from <ja>絶つ</ja>, so as long as you know that word you know this one as well.
